title: Density - average density of box of spheres

content.question: The cubical box shown in the figure has edges with length <math alttext="0.50 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. The box, which has negligible mass, is filled with <math alttext="125" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>125</mn></math> identical spheres that each has a density of <math alttext="100 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></math> and a radius of <math alttext="0.050 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.050</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. The average density of the box with the spheres inside is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="0.082 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.082</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msup></math>
<math alttext="6.5 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msup></math>
<math alttext="52 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>52</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msup></math>
<math alttext="100 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="52 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>52</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
